fields.summary: when no data is available for a table in the expandos a "This <x> has no <y>" message should be displayed instead of an empty table

fields.description:
On the launch config landing page, when the expanded row is open, many information seem to be missing, including the image name.

See the attached.

It was tested on AWS.
fields.summary: On Launch Config Landing Page, Image Name doesn't get displayed in the expanded row

comments.body: can load image info on demand

I just tried to reproduce. I named an image, and it appears properly in my previously created launch configs' expando. I do find that if I login right away and haven't been to the images page, the name won't appear. I'm adding images and allimages to data_deps for that page.

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-console/pull/210

This fix may not fix the aws situation, but it certainly does on euca.
with aws, if a public image is used in a launch config, there is a good chance we might not have access to that record right away if a) proxy cache isn't fetched or b) browser hasn't finished pulling list from proxy. This specific problem is something we'll have to address in a later release.

[~dkavanagh] when testing this against AWS I see "<empty>" tag for the missing fields in launch config expandos. Is this expected/correct behavior for your fix? (against euca this is not the case the fields are propagated imediately)

When logged into AWS, there will be some cases where the image that the expando needs isn't loaded. This would only be true for images not owned by the user. The public images take time to fetch from amazon and generally, once those are fetched, the expando should show the data properly.
[~dkavanagh] got it. But instead of just being blank, fields that have no value are shown as "<empty>". Is that the desired behavior?
They actually say "<empty>"? This is definitely *not* desired behavior.
Almighty UX master [~jloza] has decreed that "<empty>" shall not appear in expandos for fields without data.

[~kyolee] add this <empty> thing in the css
(https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-console/commit/6aaa0324a51fe8f84c051d4cd4b3e95870cc2714)
I can remove it, but maybe he can comment.

The fix was related to:

https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/EUCA-6513

The pull request on:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-console/pull/201
[~jloza], can you look at the issue Kyo linked? Should we back out that other change, or simply do something different?
That issue was not fixed as requested. I commented in that ticket, which should be rejected and fixed as requested in the image description.
backed out change done for other bug which added <empty>. Should be fine now.

Fix Verified.

Empty fields are just blank, they do not display "<empty>"

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus-console
Arch        : noarch
Version     : 3.4.1
Release     : 0.0.1170.20131115git3d6b702d.el6
